issue.title: How to run gazebo integrated unit test

content.raw:
Most of our tests are in the `test/integration` folder. Often they use a test world with specific models and plugins (such as the [pioneer2dx.cc test](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/42215f2019f5ae64fc8a0610ef804a0fc53b0740/test/integration/pioneer2dx.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default)). One can also spawn models dynamically, like in the [joint_spawn.cc](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/42215f2019f5ae64fc8a0610ef804a0fc53b0740/test/integration/joint_spawn.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) test. Recently I've been converting some of the tests using dynamic spawning to use a static world file instead, since it's easier to load in gazebo to reproduce the test behavior.

We should make a tutorial about this, but in the meantime, hopefully those are helpful examples.
content.html:
Most of our tests are in the test/integration folder. Often they use a test world with specific models and plugins (such as the pioneer2dx.cc test). One can also spawn models dynamically, like in the joint_spawn.cc test. Recently I've been converting some of the tests using dynamic spawning to use a static world file instead, since it's easier to load in gazebo to reproduce the test behavior.

We should make a tutorial about this, but in the meantime, hopefully those are helpful examples.
